plants.name: Helianthus annuus
plants.description: A tall annual plant with large, bright yellow flower heads that track the sun's movement. Sunflowers are widely cultivated for their seeds and oil and are also popular in gardens for their cheerful appearance.
plants.location: Native to North America; cultivated worldwide, especially in temperate regions
plants.funFact: Sunflowers exhibit heliotropism when young, turning their heads to follow the sun across the sky.

plants.name: Hibiscus rosa-sinensis
plants.description: A tropical shrub known for its large, showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that come in a variety of vivid colors. Often grown ornamentally in warm climates and greenhouses.
plants.bloomingSeason: Year-round in tropical climates; peaks in summer
plants.location: Native to East Asia; cultivated in tropical and subtropical regions globally
plants.funFact: Hibiscus flowers usually last only a day but bloom continuously throughout their season.

plants.name: Gentiana scabra
plants.description: A perennial wildflower with striking trumpet-shaped blue to purple flowers. Known for its intense flower color and medicinal properties in East Asia.
plants.location: Native to East Asia, especially Japan and China
plants.funFact: Gentians are often indicators of healthy alpine or mountainous ecosystems due to their specialized growth requirements.

plants.name: Coreopsis tinctoria
plants.description: An annual wildflower featuring daisy-like yellow and crimson flowers. Popular in wildflower meadows and used for natural dye production.
plants.location: Native to central and western North America
plants.funFact: The species name 'tinctoria' refers to its historical use as a source of dye.
